name: coconut
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ C ] a large fruit like a nut with a thick, hard, brown shell covered in fibre (= a mass of thread-like parts) and containing hard, white flesh that can be eaten and a clear liquid: a coconut shell
Alessandro De Carli/EyeEm/GettyImages
[ C ] (also coconut palm, coconut tree) the tall tropical tree on which coconuts grow: coconut groves It's a classic Pacific island. There is white sand, and at the edge, coconut trees ring the whole island.
Jassada Wattanaungoon/EyeEm/GettyImages
B1 [ U ] the white flesh of the coconut, often used in cooking: You can also add coconut to the cookie mix if you like. grated/shredded coconut
Adam Smigielski/E+/GettyImages
[ U ] fibres from the outside of a coconut, used as a material: These new boots are actually made from coconut and hemp. They use flooring materials such as coconut, sisal, and jute. Synonym
coir
Osvaldo Hernandez/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesIt's sobering to realize that one of the major killers in the area is having a coconut fall on your head.fruity rum cocktails served in coconut shellsIt was an uninhabited patch of sand not much larger than a football field, with no vegetation except for a few coconut palms.This is like a choice between coconut cake and coconut pie, and I love both.
